decks.notes: The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage and maintaining control of the board. The deck includes disruptive spells like Force of Will and Fatal Push, along with powerful card draw options like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional card advantage and recursion of key permanents. The deck also features a strong mana base with efficient mana rocks like Black Lotus and Moxen, as well as powerful land disruption with cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine.

The primary focus of this deck is to utilize the powerful combo of Doomsday to set up a winning play. This involves efficiently using cards like Dark Ritual, Demonic Tutor, and Ponder to stack the deck with the necessary cards, such as Thassa's Oracle and the right combination of spells, to ensure victory. The deck also includes key disruption cards like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo. By carefully strategizing and understanding the sequencing of cards, players can unleash a devastating and game-winning Doomsday combo.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful mana accelerants and control spells to effectively disrupt opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage. It aims to control the pace of the game through countering threats, removing key permanents, and leveraging powerful card draw and tutoring effects. Utilizing cards like Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value and recursion, while cards like Time Vault and Paradoxical Outcome provide alternative win conditions. Overall, the deck emphasizes resource management, disruption, and efficient control elements to outmaneuver opponents in the Vintage format.

The deck aims to generate a large amount of mana using artifacts like Grim Monolith and Mishra's Workshop, then utilize cards like Paradoxical Outcome to draw a significant amount of cards and find key pieces like The One Ring or Otawara, Soaring City to win the game. The deck also includes cards like Mana Vault, Mana Crypt, and Moxen to accelerate its game plan, while cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Mystic Forge provide additional utility and card advantage. Ultimately, the deck's goal is to assemble its combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent before they can respond.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost spells and efficient creatures to maintain board control and pressure the opponent. By consistently drawing into powerful cards such as Ancestral Recall and Treasure Cruise, the deck aims to quickly build up card advantage and overwhelm the opponent with tempo advantage. The inclusion of Wrenn and Six provides additional value by recurring lands and providing targeted removal, further enhancing the deck's ability to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and maintain control of the game through a combination of efficient threats and disruptive spells.

The deck focuses on generating card advantage, disruption, and controlling the game through countermagic and removal spells. It utilizes powerful restricted Vintage cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk, as well as efficient mana rocks like Moxen and Sol Ring. The key strategy is to establish a strong board presence with Lurrus of the Dream-Den and Urza's Saga, while disrupting opponents' game plan with cards like Force of Will and Fatal Push. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents in a grindy game of attrition.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting opponents with counterspells and removal while generating value with cards like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The deck also includes powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Time Vault to gain advantage and potentially win the game. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional consistency and recursion, while cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine help control the opponent's resources. The deck aims to control the game with a combination of disruption and card advantage, ultimately securing victory through strategic plays and powerful synergies.

The deck focuses on using Oath of Druids to cheat powerful creatures into play, such as Atraxa, Grand Unifier. It includes various counterspells and disruption cards to control the game while setting up its powerful combos. Show and Tell and Flash can also be used to put creatures into play quickly. The deck also includes card advantage spells like Ancestral Recall and Demonic Tutor to find key pieces. Overall, the strategy revolves around controlling the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and spells.

The deck aims to quickly assemble the necessary cards to cast Doomsday, which allows the player to stack their deck in a specific order to win the game with Thassa's Oracle. The deck includes a combination of fast mana, card draw, and countermagic to protect the combo and win the game in a single turn. The key concept is to efficiently and effectively find and cast Doomsday while navigating through opponent's disruption to set up the win condition with Thassa's Oracle.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo using Doomsday to set up a winning play by stacking the deck with key cards like Thassa's Oracle and Underworld Breach. It also includes various tutors, counter spells, and card draw to help find and protect the combo pieces. The goal is to execute a quick and efficient win condition, making the most of cards like Dark Ritual and Black Lotus to generate mana and storm count. The deck is designed to out-maneuver opponents and create a winning scenario within a few turns.

This Dimir Control deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining card advantage and control of the board. Using powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Force of Will, along with disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation, the deck aims to control the game until it can assemble a winning combination of threats or lock the opponent out of the game. By utilizing its efficient mana base and powerful control elements, the deck seeks to outlast and outmaneuver its opponents in order to secure victory.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful control spells and disruptive cards to outmaneuver the opponent. With a mix of counterspells, removal, and card draw, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win conditions. The inclusion of cards like Urza's Saga, Lrien Revealed, and Orcish Bowmasters provides additional value and threats to pressure the opponent. By efficiently controlling the game and generating advantage, this deck aims to dominate the opponent in the Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies while deploying efficient threats and generating card advantage. It combines aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Oko, Thief of Crowns with disruptive elements like Collector Ouphe and Leovold, Emissary of Trest. The deck aims to control the board with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, while also utilizing powerful cards like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time to outvalue opponents. By applying pressure while disrupting opponent's plays, this deck seeks to secure victory in the midrange game.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the game and outvalue the opponent. With a combination of powerful cards like Collector Ouphe, Deathrite Shaman, Oko, Thief of Crowns, and Force of Will, the deck aims to establish board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Narset, Parter of Veils, Leovold, Emissary of Trest, and Hullbreacher adds additional control elements, while cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk provide card advantage and tempo advantage. The deck's versatility and synergy make it a formidable force in the Vintage format.

The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures with disruptive abilities to slow down the opponent while maintaining pressure. By utilizing hatebears like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Archon of Emeria, it aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and control the board. The inclusion of mana acceleration with cards like Chrome Mox and the Moxen allows for explosive starts, while cards like Cavern of Souls and Chancellor of the Annex provide protection for the creatures. The deck also has ways to deal with threats through cards like Solitude and Emeria's Call.

This deck focuses on disruptive and aggressive creatures, supported by hate cards that slow down the opponent's game plan. By playing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Archon of Emeria, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's spells and limit their options. The hatebears are backed up by powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen to accelerate the deck's game plan. Additionally, cards like Strip Mine and Wasteland can disrupt the opponent's mana base, while cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere can further hinder their ability to cast spells efficiently.
